revised_title: Fossil Plants and the Age of Tertiary Basalts in the North-East Atlantic
tldr: The author investigates the fossil plants found in the Tertiary basalts of the North-East Atlantic and their implications for the age of the rocks. They discovered a rich flora, including various species of dicotyledons, conifers, and other plants, which helped determine the age and extent of the fluviatile rocks in the region.
